snippet: Senator Barbara Boxer of California has known almost from the day she took office that winning a second term would not be easy. As one of the most liberal Democrats on Capitol Hill, she is a polarizing figure who attracts critics more easily than ...
lead_paragraph: Senator Barbara Boxer of California has known almost from the day she took office that winning a second term would not be easy. As one of the most liberal Democrats on Capitol Hill, she is a polarizing figure who attracts critics more easily than most politicians do, and her resulting ''negatives'' in the polls have always been high. Now, with Election Day just six weeks off, her already tough battle against her Republican opponent, State Treasurer Matt Fong, is looking even more difficult.
abstract: Sen Barbara Boxer of California faces tough challenge from State Treasurer Matt Fong; new poll by Los Angeles Times shows her with eight-point lead among registered voters, but Fong with five-point lead when results are narrowed to cover only registered voters who are likely to vote; her photo (S)

headline.main: An Uphill Climb, With Ankle Weights
